parameters:
"Doctor: Tell me Jennifer, what did you want to tell me?
"

"Doctor: Dime Jennifer, ¿Qué querias contarme?

Jennifer: Bueno, es algo que desde hace años me viene atormentando."

"Doctor: Tell me Jennifer, what did you want to tell me?

Jennifer: Well, it's something that has been tormenting me for years."

"Doctor: Dime Jennifer, ¿Qué querias contarme?

Jennifer: Bueno, es algo que desde hace años me viene atormentando.

Doctor: ¿Atormentando?
"

"Doctor: Tell me Jennifer, what did you want to tell me?

Jennifer: Well, it's something that has been tormenting me for years.

Doctor: Tormenting?
"

"Doctor: Dime Jennifer, ¿Qué querias contarme?

Jennifer: Bueno, es algo que desde hace años me viene atormentando.

Doctor: ¿Atormentando?

Jennifer: Si, un recuerdo de algo que me ocurrio hace muchos años.
"

"Doctor: Tell me Jennifer, what did you want to tell me?

Jennifer: Well, it's something that has been tormenting me for years.

Doctor: Tormenting?

Jennifer: Yes, a memory of something that happened to me many years ago.
"

"Doctor: Dime Jennifer, ¿Qué querias contarme?

Jennifer: Bueno, es algo que desde hace años me viene atormentando.

Doctor: ¿Atormentando?

Jennifer: Si, un recuerdo de algo que me ocurrio hace muchos años.

Jennifer: Algo que no se si fue real."

"Doctor: Tell me Jennifer, what did you want to tell me?

Jennifer: Well, it's something that has been tormenting me for years.

Doctor: Tormenting?

Jennifer: Yes, a memory of something that happened to me many years ago.

Jennifer: Something that I don't know if it was real."

"Doctor: Dime Jennifer, ¿Qué querias contarme?

Jennifer: Bueno, es algo que desde hace años me viene atormentando.

Doctor: ¿Atormentando?

Jennifer: Si, un recuerdo de algo que me ocurrio hace muchos años.

Jennifer: Algo que no se si fue real.

Jennifer: Pero mi mente simplemente no me ha dejado olvidarlo."

"Doctor: Tell me Jennifer, what did you want to tell me?

Jennifer: Well, it's something that has been tormenting me for years.

Doctor: Tormenting?

Jennifer: Yes, a memory of something that happened to me many years ago.

Jennifer: Something that I don't know if it was real.

Jennifer: But my mind just won't let me forget it."
"Jennifer: Un recuerdo que solo me ha causado pesadillas."
"Jennifer: A memory that has only given me nightmares."

"Jennifer: Un recuerdo que solo me ha causado pesadillas.

Jennifer: Contarle a alguien lo que me paso, espero que me deje tranquila."

"Jennifer: A memory that has only given me nightmares.

Jennifer: Telling someone what happened to me, I hope it leaves me alone."

"Jennifer: Un recuerdo que solo me ha causado pesadillas.

Jennifer: Contarle a alguien lo que me paso, espero que me deje tranquila.

Doctor: Muy bien, vamos a hacer lo que podamos."

"Jennifer: A memory that has only given me nightmares.

Jennifer: Telling someone what happened to me, I hope it leaves me alone.

Doctor: Very well, let's do what we can."

"Jennifer: Un recuerdo que solo me ha causado pesadillas.

Jennifer: Contarle a alguien lo que me paso, espero que me deje tranquila.

Doctor: Muy bien, vamos a hacer lo que podamos.

Doctor: Ahora dime, ¿Qué tan frecuentes son esas pesadillas?"

"Jennifer: A memory that has only given me nightmares.

Jennifer: Telling someone what happened to me, I hope it leaves me alone.

Doctor: Very well, let's do what we can.

Doctor: Now tell me, how frequent are those nightmares?"

"Jennifer: Un recuerdo que solo me ha causado pesadillas.

Jennifer: Contarle a alguien lo que me paso, espero que me deje tranquila.

Doctor: Muy bien, vamos a hacer lo que podamos.

Doctor: Ahora dime, ¿Qué tan frecuentes son esas pesadillas?

Jennifer: Hace meses eran cada 4 o 5 días, pero hace un par de días se hicieron diarias."

"Jennifer: A memory that has only given me nightmares.

Jennifer: Telling someone what happened to me, I hope it leaves me alone.

Doctor: Very well, let's do what we can.

Doctor: Now tell me, how frequent are those nightmares?

Jennifer: Months ago they were every 4 or 5 days, but a couple of days ago they became daily."
"Jennifer: Llevo días sin poder dormir tranquila."
"Jennifer: I haven't been able to sleep peacefully for days."

"Jennifer: Llevo días sin poder dormir tranquila.

Jennifer: No dejo de ver su rostro."

"Jennifer: I haven't been able to sleep peacefully for days.

Jennifer: I can't stop seeing her face."

"Jennifer: Llevo días sin poder dormir tranquila.

Jennifer: No dejo de ver su rostro.

Jennifer: No puedo olvidar su sonrisa, sus ojos, y todo lo que vi ese día."

"Jennifer: I haven't been able to sleep peacefully for days.

Jennifer: I can't stop seeing her face.

Jennifer: I can't forget her smile, her eyes, and everything I saw that day."

"Jennifer: Llevo días sin poder dormir tranquila.

Jennifer: No dejo de ver su rostro.

Jennifer: No puedo olvidar su sonrisa, sus ojos, y todo lo que vi ese día.

Doctor: Jennifer, para poder entenderte necesito que me expliques de que hablas."

"Jennifer: I haven't been able to sleep peacefully for days.

Jennifer: I can't stop seeing her face.

Jennifer: I can't forget her smile, her eyes, and everything I saw that day.

Doctor: Jennifer, in order to understand you I need you to explain to me what you are talking about."

"Jennifer: Llevo días sin poder dormir tranquila.

Jennifer: No dejo de ver su rostro.

Jennifer: No puedo olvidar su sonrisa, sus ojos, y todo lo que vi ese día.

Doctor: Jennifer, para poder entenderte necesito que me expliques de que hablas.

Doctor: ¿De quien estás hablando?"

"Jennifer: I haven't been able to sleep peacefully for days.

Jennifer: I can't stop seeing her face.

Jennifer: I can't forget her smile, her eyes, and everything I saw that day.

Doctor: Jennifer, in order to understand you I need you to explain to me what you are talking about.

Doctor: Who are you talking about?"

"Jennifer: Llevo días sin poder dormir tranquila.

Jennifer: No dejo de ver su rostro.

Jennifer: No puedo olvidar su sonrisa, sus ojos, y todo lo que vi ese día.

Doctor: Jennifer, para poder entenderte necesito que me expliques de que hablas.

Doctor: ¿De quien estás hablando?

Jennifer: De ella, alguien que parecía amigable, pero resulto ser algo que no puedo explicar sin parecer que estoy loca."

"Jennifer: I haven't been able to sleep peacefully for days.

Jennifer: I can't stop seeing her face.

Jennifer: I can't forget her smile, her eyes, and everything I saw that day.

Doctor: Jennifer, in order to understand you I need you to explain to me what you are talking about.

Doctor: Who are you talking about?

Jennifer: Her, someone who seemed friendly, but turned out to be something I can't explain without sounding like I'm crazy."
"Doctor: Creo que debes de explicarme mejor, no te entiendo."
"Doctor: I think you should explain it to me better, I don't understand you."

"Doctor: Creo que debes de explicarme mejor, no te entiendo.

Doctor: ¿Te refieres a una persona?"

"Doctor: I think you should explain it to me better, I don't understand you.

Doctor: Do you mean a person?"

"Doctor: Creo que debes de explicarme mejor, no te entiendo.

Doctor: ¿Te refieres a una persona?

Jennifer: Si, o al menos es lo que quiero creer."

"Doctor: I think you should explain it to me better, I don't understand you.

Doctor: Do you mean a person?

Jennifer: Yes, or at least that's what I want to believe."

"Doctor: Creo que debes de explicarme mejor, no te entiendo.

Doctor: ¿Te refieres a una persona?

Jennifer: Si, o al menos es lo que quiero creer.

Jennifer: Pero simplemente no recuerdo bien todo lo que paso ese día, solo recuerdo su sonrisa, y sus grandes ojos."

"Doctor: I think you should explain it to me better, I don't understand you.

Doctor: Do you mean a person?

Jennifer: Yes, or at least that's what I want to believe.

Jennifer: But I just don't remember well everything that happened that day, I only remember her smile, and her big eyes."
"Jennifer: Esos ojos que con solo verlos, uno se quedaba paralizado del miedo."
"Jennifer: Those eyes that just by seeing them, one would be paralyzed with fear."

"Jennifer: Esos ojos que con solo verlos, uno se quedaba paralizado del miedo.

Jennifer: Son solo recuerdos, pero en mis pesadillas se siente tan real, que no puedo distinguir si estoy durmiendo o estoy despierta."

"Jennifer: Those eyes that just by seeing them, one would be paralyzed with fear.

Jennifer: They're just memories, but in my nightmares it feels so real, I can't tell if I'm sleeping or awake."

"Jennifer: Esos ojos que con solo verlos, uno se quedaba paralizado del miedo.

Jennifer: Son solo recuerdos, pero en mis pesadillas se siente tan real, que no puedo distinguir si estoy durmiendo o estoy despierta.

Doctor: Quizás se trate de algún trauma en tu infancia, que tu cerebro malinterpreta con esas imágenes que ves en tus sueños."

"Jennifer: Those eyes that just by seeing them, one would be paralyzed with fear.

Jennifer: They're just memories, but in my nightmares it feels so real, I can't tell if I'm sleeping or awake.

Doctor: Maybe it's some trauma in your childhood, which your brain misinterprets with those images you see in your dreams."
"Jennifer: No doctor, se que lo que vi era real."
"Jennifer: No doctor, I know what I saw was real."

"Jennifer: No doctor, se que lo que vi era real.

Doctor: Bueno, primero debemos de hacer algunas pruebas para descartar algún trauma en la infancia que haga que tengas esas imágenes de esa persona que ves en tus pesadillas."

"Jennifer: No doctor, I know what I saw was real.

Doctor: Well, first we must do some tests to rule out any childhood trauma that causes you to have those images of that person that you see in your nightmares."

"Jennifer: No doctor, se que lo que vi era real.

Doctor: Bueno, primero debemos de hacer algunas pruebas para descartar algún trauma en la infancia que haga que tengas esas imágenes de esa persona que ves en tus pesadillas.

Jennifer: No era una persona doctor."

"Jennifer: No doctor, I know what I saw was real.

Doctor: Well, first we must do some tests to rule out any childhood trauma that causes you to have those images of that person that you see in your nightmares.

Jennifer: It wasn't a person."
"A continuación se mostraran una serie de dibujos."
"Next a series of drawings will be shown."
"She didn't want us to go in there."
"Todo estaba bien antes, pero comenzó a cambiar, a enojarse"
"Everything was fine before, but he started to change, to get angry"
"Los demás no volvieron, ella los castigó"
"The others did not return, she punished them"
"A continuación deberás escuchar una serie de audios."
"Next you must listen to a series of audios."

"No se recolento ningún VHS

La cinta continua..."

"No VHS was collected

The tape continues..."
